medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented to the ED with postprandial abdominal pain. Symptoms initially improved before she could be seen. At 9:00 AM, she began experiencing epigastric and right upper quadrant (RUQ) abdominal pain that progressively increased in intensity and was sharp in quality, radiating along the right costal margin and towards her back by 9:30 AM. She reported having similar pain in the past associated with eating, which usually resolved after a while.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cholelithiasis, TIA, hyperlipidemia, anxiety, depression, hypothyroidism, history of hysterectomy, and two C-sections.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with diabetes, hypertension, Alzheimer's disease, and osteoarthritis. No history of stroke or seizures.
